applies_if_all_true: Single phase residential purposes in an individual residence
Single phase residential purposes in an individual flat or apartment in a multiple family dwelling
Residential purposes in a multiple occupancy building with not more than two individual flats, apartments or divided living spaces
Residential purposes in a rooming house with not more than four rooms available for rent
Single or three phase service to premises owned or leased by not-for-profit corporations for religious purposes
Single phase farm service supplied through the farm residence meter
Single or three phase service primarily in connection with a community residence operated by a not-for-profit corporation as defined in the Mental Hygiene Law
Posts and halls owned or leased by a not-for-profit veterans' organization
Use predominantly or primarily in connection with religious purposes by corporations or associations organized and conducted in good faith for religious purposes
does_not_apply_if_true: Premises use is not predominantly for religious purposes or reasonably incidental to religious purposes
Non-religious uses predominate and cannot be physically segregated and separately metered

applies_if_all_true: Single or three phase residential purposes at the option of customers who would otherwise be served under Service Classification No. 1
Use to an individual residence, a flat or apartment in a multiple family dwelling
Residential purposes in a multiple occupancy building where not more than two individual flats, apartments or divided living spaces are available
Residential purposes in a roominghouse where not more than four rooms are available for rent
Farm service when supplied through the farm residence meter

Single or three phase service to any premise owned or leased by any not-for-profit corporation association or body organized and conducted in good faith for religious purposes and used primarily or principally in connection with such religious purposes

Use primarily and principally in connection with a community residence as defined in the Mental Hygiene Law operated by a not-for-profit corporation and either a supervised living facility providing 24-hour per day on-site supervision and living accommodations for 14 or fewer residents or a supportive living facility providing supervised independent living without 24-hour per day on-site supervision
Posts and halls owned or leased by a not-for-profit corporation that is a veterans' organization
Available throughout the Company's service area from existing circuits of adequate capacity and appropriate character
Subject to availability of suitable metering equipment and continuous Company access including bimonthly access to the meter to record usage
Written application upon the Company's prescribed forms may be required
All purposes required by customer on the premises for which no other service classification is specifically provided
Entire requirements are delivered at one point and singly metered at the delivery voltage (except as provided in Special Provision C)
Available throughout the Company's service area from existing circuits of adequate capacity and appropriate character

classification_shift_rules: A customer once served under this service classification shall remain on this service classification until the monthly measured demand exceeds 100 kW for twelve consecutive months following the initial term of service, except as provided in Special Provision I, whereupon service may be taken under another appropriate service classification
change_of_classification_conditions: Remain on this service classification until the monthly measured demand exceeds 100 kW for twelve consecutive months following the initial term of service

applies_if_all_true: Customer provides a load letter (load sheet) upon request
Charging Ratio determined at time of application and remains until updated by customer
All requirements delivered at one Retail Delivery Point and singly metered with respect to the delivery voltage
Monthly measured demand has equaled or exceeded 100 kW in each of the previous twelve months
Or in the Company's opinion the applicant's demand will equal or exceed 100 kW in twelve consecutive months
Available throughout the Company's service area from existing circuits of adequate capacity and appropriate character
does_not_apply_if_true: Monthly measured demand has been less than 100 kW for twelve consecutive months following the initial Term of Service

change_of_classification_conditions: Customer once served under this service classification shall remain on this service classification until the monthly measured demand has been less than 100 kW for twelve consecutive months following the initial Term of Service

tariff_entries.label: All Delivery Voltages Reactive Demand Charge

applies_if_all_true: Service available throughout the Company's service area from existing circuits of adequate capacity and appropriate character
Service provided for all purposes required by a customer on the premises
Entire requirements delivered at one Retail Delivery Point and singly metered with respect to the delivery voltage

classification_shift_rules: Customer once served under SC-3A shall remain on this service classification until monthly measured demand falls below specified thresholds for a consecutive number of months
Customers receiving SC-4 Supplemental Service assigned to parent service classifications based on prior SC-3A service and demand thresholds
change_of_classification_conditions: SC-3A before September 1, 1998: Monthly demand exceeds 2,000 kW in any two consecutive months of previous twelve months triggers classification; remain until demand is 1,500 kW or less for twelve consecutive months

SC-3A after September 1, 1998: Monthly demand exceeds 2,000 kW in any six consecutive months of previous twelve months triggers classification; remain until demand is 1,800 kW or less for six consecutive months
Effective July 1, 2013, billed demands for Niagara Power Delivery Service included in demand calculations
